meanings.definition: A system in which employees can vary their starting and finishing times within agreed limits.
meanings.sent1: At our company, we have flexitimes, so I can start work a bit later if needed.
meanings.sent2: Flexitimes allow employees to adjust their schedules to better suit their needs.
meanings.sent3: The office manager joked that with flexitimes, we could all become night owls and work in our pajamas.
meanings.sent4: Flexitimes are like a colorful palette, letting each employee paint their workday as they wish.
meanings.sent5: With flexitimes, the work environment feels more flexible and accommodating.

meanings.definition: The practice of allowing employees to choose their own working hours within certain limits.
meanings.sent1: Flexitimes give employees the freedom to decide when they want to start and finish work.
meanings.sent2: In our office, flexitimes have improved employee satisfaction and productivity.
meanings.sent3: Sarah found it amusing that flexitimes meant she could work while watching her favorite TV show.
meanings.sent4: Flexitimes are like a magic wand, granting employees the power to control their work hours.
meanings.sent5: The concept of flexitimes makes the work-life balance much easier to achieve.
